en-AU.summary: Story time, then lullabies followed by Gentle melodies to help your child stay fast asleep.
examplePhrases: Alexa, ask dream time to play
en-AU.name: Dream Time
en-AU.description:
This plays yesterdays live abc kids listen stream any time of the day.
It will start with;
Bedtime Stories (0.5 hours): Soothing stories for winding down and getting ready for bed.
Then Lullabies (1.5 hours): Lull your child to sleep with relaxing
And end with Dream Time (3 hours): Classic lullabies., Gentle melodies help your child stay fast asleep.

To start, just say "Alexa, launch dream time" or "Alexa, play dream time" to start the playlist.

You can skip to the next section by saying "Alexa, next".

At anytime, you can stop the radio by saying "Alexa, stop".


This is an un-official skill to access the worldwide radio that https://radio.abc.net.au provides, more information can be found at https://radio.abc.net.au/help/streams (ABC KIDS listen)

Material can be found at 
https://www.abc.net.au/kidslisten/bedtime-stories/
https://www.abc.net.au/kidslisten/lullabies/
https://www.abc.net.au/kidslisten/dream-time/

publishingInformation.testingInstructions:
Music content from https://abcradiomodhls-vh.akamaihd.net/i/kidslisten/audio/* . Upstream internet radio station will work out end user ip address to their geo country and will alter radio stream content to meet international licence restrictions.

This is a simple skill to play the evening story, lullabies and sleep track that is also on the abc kids listen radio at any time of day instead of restricted to AEST evening time. This could be done as a podcast via the generic interface but due to the generic names and structure for kids, this is not really suitable for a sleep session.
